titleInfo.title: "Nurses To Pay Tribute Friday To Memphis' Angels Of Mercy"

mods.abstract: "A service flag with 79 stars honoring Memphis nurses who already have joined the Army or Navy or are soon to do so, will be presented at a meeting of District No. 1 of the Tennessee State Nurses' Association at University Center at 7:30 o'clock Friday night by Mrs. Richard Saint, representing the local chapter of the Red Cross... Mrs. Frances Cunningham will conduct a memorial service in honor of Miss Imogene Kennedy, a graduate of the University of Tennessee's School of Nursing, who has been missing since the fall of Corregidor. Miss Clarice Corbett will place a gold star on the service flag for Miss Kennedy, and a bugler from the American Legion will sound taps...."

relatedItem.abstract: A collection of all things Memphis... a little bit of this, a little bit of that. The M Files is a great place to find portraits and newspaper clippings, but also so much more. As the clippings from the Memphis Information File are digitized, they will be added to The M Files, but so will the smaller manuscript collections and most of the items used to create the topical digital displays in the Memphis Room.
